system.description:
Your mix of magic, faith, artistic skill, and general knowledge has made you something of a leader, whether you set out to be one or not. You gain the following benefits:

  • If a spell appears on both the bard and cleric lists for you, you add your bard and cleric levels together to determine whether you can prepare the spell. Such a spell must be prepared as a cleric spell (counting as usual against the class’s prepared spells limit).
  • At the beginning of your turn, you can spend a use of Channel Divinity to recover a number of uses of Bardic Inspiration equal to half your proficiency bonus (no action required), up to your maximum number of uses of Bardic Inspiration.
  • When you cast with a Vocalized component, you can obscure your magic in in scripture and religious jargon. To do so, make a Deception or Performance check. Any observers with a passive Insight score equal to or less than the result of your check do not see or hear you cast the spell. Once you have used this benefit a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
  • You gain a free inexperienced follower of the Diviner, Healer, or Minstrel type. This follower does not count against your maximum number of followers.
